    "name": "a(n) is the smallest positive integer of length (distance from origin) n in the Cayley graph of the integers generated by all powers of 11.",

        "Conjectures from _Colin Barker_, Dec 28 2017: (Start)",
        "G.f.: x*(1 + x + x^2 + x^3 + x^4 - 10*x^5) / ((1 - x)*(1 - 11*x^5)).",
        "a(n) = a(n-1) + 11*a(n-5) - 11*a(n-6) for n>5.",
        "(End)",
        "The second conjecture by Colin Barker is true up to n=1000. - _Lars Blomberg_, Dec 29 2017"
